meta.title: VibeCap — Boost Your Vibe Coding
meta.description: A screenshot tool built specifically for vibe coding. Capture, annotate, and send to your editor in one flow.

hero.headline: Boost your vibe coding
hero.subheadline: by fixing the way you take screenshots

problems.title: Why screenshots slow you down today
problems.subtitle: macOS screenshots are powerful. But once you start vibe coding, they become friction.

items.title: The screenshot disappears before you're ready
items.description: You take a screenshot. If you don't grab it immediately and drop it into the input box in time, it's gone. Now you're digging through folders. That moment of flow is already broken.

items.title: Moving screenshots across windows is fragile
items.description: Even if you catch the screenshot, you still have to drag it across screens, find the right window, aim for the right input box. Miss once, and you're retrying.

items.title: Multiple screenshots mean repeated pain
items.description: Need to send two or three screenshots together? You repeat the same steps again and again: capture → grab → drag → drop. It's slow. And it pulls you out of your thinking every time.

items.title: Annotation exists, but doesn't help much
items.description: macOS annotation tools technically work. But they're not designed for explaining problems to an editor: switching tools, clicking tiny buttons, marking without context.

solution.title: What VibeCap changes
solution.subtitle: VibeCap is not a replacement for your editor. It fixes the moment before you talk to it.

flow.step4: Send everything to your editor — once

benefits: No repeating the same action three times

workflow.title: Built for vibe coding workflows
workflow.description: VibeCap understands how vibe coding actually works: You don't want to explain everything. You want to show, then say a few words.
workflow.note: At the moment you're still in context.

items.title: Prompt + image, sent together
points: Image(s) and text go into the editor at the same time

items.title: Editor-friendly by design
points: Works naturally with modern coding tools
